pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.5.eng: 10. The training rule on digging the earth

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū navakammaṃ karontā pathaviṃ khaṇantipi khaṇāpentipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.2.eng: At that time the monks of Āḷavī were doing building work, and they dug the earth and had it dug.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā pathaviṃ khaṇissantipi khaṇāpessantipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics dig the earth and have it dug?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.6.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma āḷavakā bhikkhū pathaviṃ khaṇissantipi khaṇāpessantipī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.8.eng: “How can those monks at Āḷavī dig the earth and have it dug?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, pathaviṃ khaṇathapi khaṇāpethapī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, pathaviṃ khaṇissathapi khaṇāpessathapi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.13.eng: People regard the earth as conscious.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu pathaviṃ khaṇeyya vā khaṇāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk digs the earth or has it dug, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.6.pli: dve pathaviyo— jātā ca pathavī ajātā ca pathavī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.6.eng: there are two kinds of earth: productive earth and unproductive earth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.8.pli: suddhapaṃsu suddhamattikā appapāsāṇā appasakkharā appakaṭhalā appamarumbā appavālikā, yebhuyyenapaṃsukā, yebhuyyenamattikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.8.eng: pure soil, pure clay, with few stones, with few pebbles, with few potsherds, with little gravel, with little sand; mostly soil, mostly clay.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.9.eng: If it is unburned, it is also called “productive earth”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.10.pli: Yopi paṃsupuñjo vā mattikāpuñjo vā atirekacātumāsaṃ ovaṭṭho, ayampi vuccati jātā pathavī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.10.eng: A pile of soil or clay that has been rained on for more than four months—this too is called “productive earth”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.12.pli: suddhapāsāṇā suddhasakkharā suddhakaṭhalā suddhamarumbā suddhavālikā appapaṃsukā appamattikā, yebhuyyenapāsāṇā, yebhuyyenasakkharā, yebhuyyenakaṭhalā, yebhuyyenamarumbā, yebhuyyenavālikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.12.eng: just stones, just pebbles, just potsherds, just gravel, just sand, with little soil, with little clay; mostly stones, mostly pebbles, mostly potsherds, mostly gravel, mostly sand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.13.eng: If it is burned, it is also called “unproductive earth”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.14.pli: Yopi paṃsupuñjo vā mattikāpuñjo vā omakacātumāsaṃ ovaṭṭho, ayampi vuccati ajātā pathavī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.14.eng: A pile of soil or clay that has been rained on for less than four months—this too is called “unproductive earth”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.16.eng: if he digs it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.18.eng: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.19.pli: Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.19.eng: If he only asks once, then even if the other digs a lot, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.19.comm: “A lot” renders bahukaṁ. Sp 2.86: Sakiṁ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇatīti sacepi sakaladivasaṁ khaṇati, āṇāpakassa ekaṁyeva pācittiyaṁ, “Sakiṁ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇatīti: there is only one offense entailing confession for the one who asks, even if the other digs the entire day.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.1.pli: Pathaviyā pathavisaññī khaṇati vā khaṇāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, dahati vā dahāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.1.eng: If it is earth, and he perceives it as such, and he digs it or has it dug, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he burns it or has it burned, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.2.pli: Pathaviyā vematiko khaṇati vā khaṇāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, dahati vā dahāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.2.eng: If it is earth, but he is unsure of it, and he digs it or has it dug, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he burns it or has it burned, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.3.pli: Pathaviyā apathavisaññī khaṇati vā khaṇāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, dahati vā dahāpeti vā, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.3.eng: If it is earth, but he does not perceive it as such, and he digs it or has it dug, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he burns it or has it burned, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.4.eng: If it is not earth, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.5.eng: If it is not earth, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.6.eng: If it is not earth, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.2.pli: “imaṃ jāna, imaṃ dehi, imaṃ āhara, iminā attho, imaṃ kappiyaṃ karohī”ti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.2.eng: if he says, “Consider this,” “Give this,” “Bring this,” “There’s need for this,” “Make this allowable;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on digging the earth, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.9.eng: The first subchapter on lying is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.13.eng: Except with one who understands, true,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū navakammaṃ karontā rukkhaṃ chindantipi chedāpentipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.2.eng: At that time the monks of Āḷavī were doing building work, and they cut down trees and had them cut down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.3.eng: Then, when a certain monk was cutting down a tree,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.4.pli: Tasmiṃ rukkhe adhivatthā devatā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.4.eng: the deity that lived in it said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.5.pli: “mā, bhante, attano bhavanaṃ kattukāmo mayhaṃ bhavanaṃ chindī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.5.eng: “Venerable, don’t cut down our dwelling because you want to build a dwelling for yourself.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.6.pli: So bhikkhu anādiyanto chindiyeva, tassā ca devatāya dārakassa bāhuṃ ākoṭesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.6.eng: Not taking any heed, he just cut it down, and he hurt the arm of that deity’s child.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.8.eng: “Why don’t I just kill this monk?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.10.pli: “na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ yāhaṃ imaṃ bhikkhuṃ idheva jīvitā voropeyyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.10.eng: “It wouldn’t be right to just kill this monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.11.eng: Let me instead tell the Buddha about this matter.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.12.pli: Atha kho sā devatā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.12.eng: And it approached the Buddha and told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.14.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṃ, devate, taṃ bhikkhuṃ jīvitā na voropesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.14.eng: It’s good that you didn’t kill that monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.15.pli: Sacajja tvaṃ, devate, taṃ bhikkhuṃ jīvitā voropeyyāsi, bahuñca tvaṃ, devate, apuññaṃ pasaveyyāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.15.eng: If you had killed that monk, you would have made much demerit.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.16.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, devate, amukasmiṃ okāse rukkho vivitto tasmiṃ upagacchā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.16.eng: The tree over there is empty. Take that as your dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.17.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā rukkhaṃ chindissantipi chedāpessantipi ekindriyaṃ samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jīvaṃ viheṭhentī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.18.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics cut down trees and have them cut down? They are hurting life with one sense.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.19.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.19.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.20.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.20.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.21.pli: “kathañhi nāma āḷavakā bhikkhū rukkhaṃ chindissantipi chedāpessantipī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.21.eng: “How can those monks at Āḷavī cut down trees and have them cut down?”…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.22.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, rukkhaṃ chindathāpi chedāpethāpī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.22.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.25.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, rukkhaṃ chindissathāpi, chedāpessathāpi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.25.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.28.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.28.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:1.29.1.eng: ‘If a monk destroys a plant, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.2.pli: pañca bījajātāni— mūlabījaṃ, khandhabījaṃ, phaḷubījaṃ, aggabījaṃ, bījabījameva pañcamaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.2.eng: there are five kinds of propagation: propagation from roots, propagation from stems, propagation from joints, propagation from cuttings, propagation from seeds.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.4.pli: haliddi, siṅgiveraṃ, vacā, vacattaṃ, ativisā, kaṭukarohiṇī, usīraṃ, bhaddamuttakaṃ, yāni vā panaññānipi atthi mūle jāyanti, mūle sañjāyanti, etaṃ mūlabījaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.4.eng: turmeric, ginger, sweet flag, white sweet flag, atis root, black hellebore, vetiver root, nutgrass, or any other plant produced from roots, that grows from roots—this is called “propagation from roots”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.4.comm: For further details of these names and the names below, see Appendix of Plants.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.6.pli: assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā panaññānipi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.6.eng: the Bodhi tree, the banyan tree, the Indian rock fig, the cluster fig, the Indian cedar, the portia tree, or any other plant produced from stems, that grows from stems—this is called “propagation from stems”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.8.pli: ucchu, veḷu, naḷo, yāni vā panaññānipi atthi pabbe jāyanti, pabbe sañjāyanti, etaṃ phaḷubījaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.8.eng: sugarcane, bamboo, reed, or any other plant produced from joints, that grows from joints—this is called “propagation from joints”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.10.pli: ajjukaṃ, phaṇijjakaṃ, hiriveraṃ, yāni vā panaññānipi atthi agge jāyanti, agge sañjāyanti, etaṃ aggabījaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.10.eng: shrubby basil, rajmahal hemp, Vicks plant, or any other plant produced from cuttings, that grows from cuttings—this is called “propagation from cuttings”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.12.pli: pubbaṇṇaṃ, aparaṇṇaṃ, yāni vā panaññānipi atthi bīje jāyanti, bīje sañjāyanti, etaṃ bījabījaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.1.12.eng: grains, vegetables, or any other plant produced from seeds, that grows from seeds—this is called “propagation from seeds”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.1.pli: Bīje bījasaññī chindati vā chedāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, pacati vā pacāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.1.eng: If it is capable of propagation, and he perceives that it is, and he cuts it down or has it cut down, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he cooks it or has it cooked, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.1.comm: “Capable of propagation” renders bīja. Normally bīja just means seed, but in the present context living seeds is implied. Thus my rendering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.2.pli: Bīje vematiko chindati vā chedāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, pacati vā pacāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.2.eng: If it is capable of propagation, but he is unsure of it, and  he cuts it down or has it cut down, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he cooks it or has it cooked, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.3.pli: Bīje abījasaññī chindati vā chedāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, pacati vā pacāpeti vā, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.3.eng: If it is capable of propagation, but he perceives that it is not, and he cuts it down or has it cut down, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he cooks it or has it cooked, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.4.eng: If it is not capable of propagation, but he perceives that it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.5.eng: If it is not capable of propagation, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.2.6.eng: If it is not capable of propagation, and he perceives that it is not, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.2.pli: “imaṃ jāna, imaṃ dehi, imaṃ āhara, iminā attho, imaṃ kappiyaṃ karohī”ti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.2.eng: if he says, “Consider this”, “Give this”, “Bring this”, “There’s need for this”, “Make this allowable;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc11:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on plants, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:0.5.eng: 12. The training rule on evasive speech

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo anācāraṃ ācaritvā saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.2.eng: Venerable Channa was misbehaving. Then, when he was examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, he spoke evasively,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.3.pli: “ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.3.eng: “Who has committed an offense? What offense was committed? In regard to what was it committed? How was it committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.5.eng: “How can Venerable Channa speak evasively when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha?”…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.6.pli: ‘ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā’”ti …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.7.pli: saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, channa, saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicarasi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.7.eng: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.8.pli: ‘ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā’”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissasi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.11.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.12.pli: “ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.15.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.16.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno aññavādakaṃ ropetu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.16.eng: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should charge Channa with evasive speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.17.eng: And he is to be charged like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.18.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.19.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.20.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.20.eng: The monk Channa speaks evasively when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.21.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno aññavādakaṃ ropeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.21.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should charge him with evasive speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.23.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.24.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.24.eng: The monk Channa speaks evasively when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.25.eng: The Sangha is charging him with evasive speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.26.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno aññavādakassa ropanā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.26.eng: Any monk who approves of charging him with evasive speech should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.27.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.28.eng: The Sangha has charged the monk Channa with evasive speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.29.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.29.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.30.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ channaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.30.eng: After rebuking Channa in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.31.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.31.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.32.1.eng: ‘If a monk speaks evasively, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.33.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.33.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicaranto—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.1.eng: Later, when Channa was again being examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, he thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.2.eng: “By speaking evasively I’ll commit an offense,” and he instead harassed the Sangha by remaining silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ vihesessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.4.eng: “When he’s examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, how can Venerable Channa harass the Sangha by remaining silent?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, channa, saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ vihesesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.5.eng: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ vihesessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.8.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.11.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.12.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno vihesakaṃ ropetu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.12.eng: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should charge Channa with harassment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.13.eng: And he is to be charged like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.14.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.15.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.16.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.16.eng: The monk Channa, when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, harasses the Sangha by remaining silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.17.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno vihesakaṃ ropeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.17.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should charge him with harassment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.19.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.20.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjīyamāno tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.20.eng: The monk Channa, when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, harasses the Sangha by remaining silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.21.eng: The Sangha is charging him with harassment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.22.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno vihesakassa ropanā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.22.eng: Any monk who approves of charging him of harassment should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.23.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.24.eng: The Sangha has charged the monk Channa with harassment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.25.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.25.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.26.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ channaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.26.eng: After rebuking Channa in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.27.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.27.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.28.1.eng: ‘If a monk speaks evasively or harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.28.1.comm: There is no equivalent of the “or” in the Pali, but it is implied by the origin story, which gives a separate offense for speaking evasively.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.2.pli: saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetukāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetukāmo aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati— “ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā”ti. Eso aññavādako nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.2.eng: when being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, he speaks evasively because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying, “Who has committed an offense? What offense was committed? In regard to what was it committed? How was it committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?”—this is called “one who speaks evasively”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.4.pli: saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetukāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetukāmo tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti. Eso vihesako nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.4.eng: when being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, he harasses the Sangha by remaining silent because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it—this is called “one who harasses”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.5.1.pli: Aropite aññavādake saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetukāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetukāmo aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.5.1.eng: If he has not been charged with evasive speech, but he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then speaks evasively because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.6.pli: “ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.6.eng: “Who has committed an offense? What offense was committed? In regard to what was it committed? How was it committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.7.pli: Aropite vihesake saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetukāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetukāmo tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.7.eng: If he has not been charged with harassment, but he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then harasses the Sangha by remaining silent because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.8.pli: Ropite aññavādake saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetukāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetukāmo aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.8.eng: If he has been charged with evasive speech, and he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then speaks evasively because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.9.pli: “ko āpanno, kiṃ āpanno, kismiṃ āpanno, kathaṃ āpanno, kaṃ bhaṇatha, kiṃ bhaṇathā”ti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.9.eng: “Who has committed an offense? What offense was committed? In regard to what was it committed? How was it committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?” then he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.10.pli: Ropite vihesake saṅghamajjhe vatthusmiṃ vā āpattiyā vā anuyuñjīyamāno taṃ na kathetukāmo taṃ na ugghāṭetukāmo tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṃ viheseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.10.eng: If he has been charged with harassment, and he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then harasses the Sangha by remaining silent because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, then he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī aññavādake vihesake, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he speaks evasively or he harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.1.comm: The legal procedure referred to here is the procedure of charging the monk with evasive speech or harassment of the Sangha. Sp 2.101: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññītiādīsu yaṁ taṁ aññavādakavihesakaropanakammaṁ kataṁ, “In regard to dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī etc.: the legal procedure done to charge (a monk) with evasive speech or harassment.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko aññavādake vihesake, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he speaks evasively or he harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī aññavādake vihesake, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he speaks evasively or he harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.2.eng: if he asks because he does not know;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.3.eng: if he does not speak because he is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.4.pli: “saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ vā kalaho vā viggaho vā vivādo vā bhavissatī”ti na katheti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.4.eng: if he does not speak because he thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.5.pli: “saṅghabhedo vā saṅgharāji vā bhavissatī”ti na katheti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.5.eng: if he does not speak because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.6.pli: “adhammena vā vaggena vā nakammārahassa vā kammaṃ karissatī”ti na katheti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.6.eng: if he does not speak because he thinks the legal procedure will be illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done to one who does not deserve a legal procedure;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.9.eng: The training rule on evasive speech, the second, is finished.
